Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ASL2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The staff of the hotel is very courteous and helpful. Since the hotel commenced operations about 2 years back, it is neat and clean. The room service of the hotel was also very prompt and efficient. The location of the hotel is almost 30 minutes away from the city center and the airport, but, it is about 10 minutes away from Mall of the Emirates. Here, you can catch the Dubai Metro. So, in my opinion, the location is not a drawback. The biggest disappointment with the hotel was its breakfast buffet. I understand that the components of the breakfast buffet have to be limited to the number of juices, fruit items, bakery items etc. But, they could at least change the items within the limits of number of items. For example, they had watermelon juice and 2 other juices every day! At best, they would change only 2 dishes in the buffet. Rest of the dishes would remain the same! Moreover, it is obvious that their chef is from South India. Because, the South Indian dishes that were prepared (and were the ones to be changed) were excellent. Other continental dishes were average. Similar thing was with their Chinese restaurant as well. One night, we ate at their Chinese restaurant as well. The taste of the food was very Indian Chinese and not authentic Chinese food. Another point of mild disappointment was their Travel Desk. The lady at the Travel Desk would spend most of her time chatting with her friends over phone, even while she's sharing information with a tourist! I would have given a rating of 5 to the hotel, but purely because of their inefficient buffet planning, I would rank the hotel as 4.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for MAll of the Emirates - that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: rovingrover_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was mediocre in all ways. Non descript rooms and public areas. Boring bars and restaurants. Staff were not rude but neither did they go out of their way to smile or be helpful. You can walk to Mall of the Emirates in November but not sure I would try it in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , clean with frienly staff”
Reviews.Author: HerbertLandshut
Reviews.Content: Even though the Hotel is not really in the city center, the Mall of the Emirate is just a 10 Minute walk away. Rooms are nice and large enough. Breakfast is on Buffet and with the exception of the offered fruit (5 days only two kind of Melons) quite acceptable. Should have more variety. Staff are very friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly service, excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay V
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and this was my 10th visit to Dubai in past one year. This was my first stay at this hotel (I've stayed earlier at other Ramadas in Dubai and at other hotels in Al Barsha). This was my best experience at any hotel in Dubai. Check-in was done in a jiffy--very friendly and efficient front desk staff. I got an upgrade to Junior Suite (Thanks Mr Mukul Gupta!) with complimentary Internet--some initial problem in getting connected but once connected pretty good speed. Very courteous room service and smiling staff all over the hotel. The gym is basic but the sauna and steam bath very good. I wish they open gym from 6 am and not 7 am. Some Indian channels would also be appreciated. I've already booked my next stay at this hotel in 3rd week of March.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: fraddock
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the hotel this January and was a little disappointed with it. Room was clean and tidy but they have cut back on the little things like the tea and coffee making within the room. We asked for some extra at the desk but were told we must contact housekeeping. We contacted housekeeping and asked for some milk rather than the creamer supplied. This was a chargeable item and on arrival we were given a litre cartoon of milk. We explained that we only required enough milk to make a cup of tea but the housemaid spoke very little English so we spoke with the on duty manager. He stated that if he gave us a small jug of milk then he would have to throw the rest away as opened milk could not be placed back into the fridges. So we accepted the litre of milk. Breakfast was also disappointing. We asked for tea and coffee but the waiter stated that he didn't serve tea and coffee and would inform the relevant person. I like many other guest went to the tea and coffee station and helped ourselves as there did not seem enough staff to cope with the breakfast period. The breakfast was average. We had read about the reports about the smoking and yes they are true. Went for a drink in the bar on the Saturday evening and it was wall to wall smoke.The hotel is located near the Mall of the Emirates but the area is still in the development stage so there are unmade areas to deal with if you are walking. Would I stay here again? No is the answer. We have travelled the middle east on numerous occasions in the past decade and Dubai has far better hotels to offer than the Ramada Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This is a disappointing hotel. You arrive in lobby that reeks of smoke, despite the fact that no smoking signs are posted. Decor manages to be cheap and garish at the same time--not attractive at all. The room that I was in was cramped and not particularly well-designed. I suppose that the location near the Mall of the Emirates is a plus, but it's on the far side of the Mall from Sheikh Zayed Road and the metro, so accessibility is not great. The breakfast buffet was, well, pathetic. The main restaurant was full, so we were shunted into the Chinese restaurant. The food was barely passable and service was atrocious--we had to wait 10 minutes for our coffee and had to struggle to get the attention of the staff. I'd give this hotel a miss unless you really just need a cheapish place to stay in Dubai...and even then, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD BASE FOR A VISIT TO DUBAI”
Reviews.Author: mike1367
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ramada Chelsea on 2 occasions in January, 9 nights in total. Despite some reviews here, the hotel is located in an excellent position being just 10 to 15 minutes walk from the Mall of the Emirates. Whilst the pavement on the main road is not made up in places, it is just as easy to walk on the parallel road behind the hotel. Here you will find a couple of supermarkets, some local eateries and a pharmacy. The Dubai Metro has a station within the Mall. An all day ticket is just AED16 allowing unlimited travel on the system. The metro is new, vey clean and highly efficient. Taxis in Dubai are relatively cheap. Hotel transport we had pre arranged to collect us from the airport was about three times the cost of a taxi! The hotel itself is very much as you might expect for a city centre business / tourist hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable albeit they do seem to vary in size quite considerably. Reception staff were always very helpfull. The Ramada Chelsea has several restaurants and a sports bar. Food quality was good but cost wise seemed a little expensive. That said, prices were very much on par to other hotels we visited in the UAE. All in all, the Ramada Chelsea is a good choice for a short stay / stop over in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lakshi79
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night recently the hotel was very clean and nice should say,the staff were very helpful Muriel at the counter and Sofia were very friendly.The room was attractive with modern decor.We booked for a twin room and were upgraded to a suite however at the check in.Unfortunately we did not have time to experience the rest of the hotel facilities as we were out most of the time. The only negative points were that we were asked to pay another 250 aed equivalent to 70 usd as a refendable deposit along with the one night stay amount which they had already blocked on my friend`s credit card.When inquired we were told it`s for additional expenses in case and we said we wont be having as we were there for a festival. However I thought this was very unusual and this was the first time it happend to us we had stayed at other hotels in dubai before and even in other countries this had never happend to us.They refunded the deposit at check out. The metro station is at the Mall of the Emirates was convienient though it required good 15 to 20 mins walk as you have to walk behind lot of buidlings due to the road construction.Other than this we thought it was a good hotel. The internet rates are quite high specially when its provided free of charge in other hotels. However we got it for free as we booked through booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner”
Reviews.Author: franktheshoe
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel close to the Mall of the Emirates, a 10 minute walk,but go around the back of the hotel for the best route, a good sports bar in the hotel and live music some nights, avoid the hotel restaurants, as very pricey with hit and miss slow service,,better to eat in the food court at the mall,also good conections to the marina and golf club from the metro at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Decent.”
Reviews.Author: Noyanika
Reviews.Content: My Stay was for around 5-6 days around the end of december. Its a decent hotel with all the basic amenities. The staff quite friendly and helpful. Food ordered in room service was good quality wise but pricey. The wifi rates are high but i took a combined thing of 3 days , which i found was quite reasonable. Breakfast buffet is actually good with lots of variety and quality food. Location however was quite average with only Mall of Emirates being near. Can be recommended to those wanting a comfort stay at low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Undeniably less than Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kaptainmirza
Reviews.Content: The reception took longer than usual to book a room for us. The TV channels were okay but most alarming was the sanitary hygiene. The bathroom fittings were noticeably needing quite a patchwork - sloppy design features were exposed. The bedsheets were stained. One of the pillows had a big stain patch which made the feeling of having germs as neighbours more uneasy for the guests. The lighting accessories were a good novelty though but would fall short to nominate this hotel for the next stay. Done once, never again..!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay... but annoying cigarette smells in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Harrasi
Reviews.Content: Recently I was on business trip to Dubai with two of my colleagues and stayed here for 4 days. Very good service and a nice hotel overall. I booked through internet and to be frank the offer was very reasonable specially if considering this time of the year. We had very fast check in and checkout process. The room size is ok and the bathroom is clean and bright but it look a bit tired considering it a newly 4 star hotel. The location of the hotel also close to Emirate mall but to Dira (where the shopping distric - 30 min). Also the hotel offer free parking assistance which is also good for those they travel by road. The only two major disappointing aspects about this hotel the charge for the WIFI is considerably high and bad smell of the lobby due to cigarettes which comes from the bar which is at the entrance of the hotel. This smell was so bad that clothes were stinking if you have to wait at the lobby. Also, the complementary water is served only for the first night and I feel it shall be provided for the number of night you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: AhmedBaghdadi
Reviews.Content: i had a very Bad Customer Service ,the reception desk OMG they are totally confuse and they dont know what they should do. and you are not friendly at all, even smile you should pay them for it. they have to price for there features (Spa).at the room high one and at the elevator cheap one. They said we have Restaurant 24hours open ,however only we have sandwiches (burgers). the only thing is good is the location.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: sonal66
Reviews.Content: location good in terms of being near to Mall of the emirates... but hotel apt for a conference group of about 100 people...as clean good rooms,bteakfast good spread with Indian food available... not convenient to major shopping areas or attractions but prices are very reasonable and value for money staff very cooperative and flexible with check in and check out time if room availabilty not an issue

Reviews.Title: “Rip off wifi”
Reviews.Author: JonJo121
Reviews.Content: Very good four star hotel, very clean and a good price. Valet parking free. Pool was pretty small. The only thing I can knock it for is the extortionate rip off for wifi. There is no need in this day and age to hold customers to ransom like this and it leaves a bitter taste in the mouth and loses customers. I was about to rebook a week later but booked a nearby hotel instead which had free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , good staff but not walkable distance to any.”
Reviews.Author: Sarita1983
Reviews.Content: I went to Dubai 2 weeks ago with a group of friends and we had 3 different reservations in there. 1- Double room 2- Junior suite 3- suite All of them were just the same , nothing was fancy about the suite or the Junior one. 1- The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. 2- room service was 24 hours but the menu was pricy. we had to order several times. 3- it's about 5 mins to Emirates mall by CAR and there is no pavement to walk to it. although it's not that far from the hotel , you would still need a car to reach it. 4- about 15 mins by car to Dubai mall and not close to the metro. 5- reasonable price and quiet. I would suggest you stay there if you cannot afford more luxury but be careful you will need to have your own car or to order a Taxi all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: XAPECAJO
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel. Before going there I red several negatives comments but that doesn't correspond to the truth. The rooms are confortable,the staff was always helpful, I got complimentary internet. We travelled in a group of 5 and everybody enjoyed the stay. It was really worth the money considering the prices of the other hotels. The FourSeasons restaurants was quite food and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: VBTLucknow
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Dubai. I had booked this hotel on a friend's recommendation. I must say the hotel truned out to be really good and much more than I expected. The best thing about the hotel is the location, its staff and not to miss the General Manager himself. The hotel is walking distance from the Mall of Emirates and quite central for most of the site seeing options. It has a couple of restaurants and the best one was the Indian. Its bar is quite a high energy and is very good for sport lovers as you get private plasma Tvs to view next to your tables. The hotel is managed by an Indian Manager- Mr Mukul and he does a great job by adding his personal touch everywhere. Some of the other great fecelities in the hotel are Gym and its swimming pool. Great place to stay in the the Centre of Dubai which has good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice .... Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: jodathegreatjedi
Reviews.Content: Pretty New hotel (and we all know how important is that) very close to the MOE thus to everything worth noticing. If you want a hotel that won't kill your budget but will supply all the need-to have basics (spacious and comfortable rooms, decent restaurants and/or breakfast, outdoor pool, wifi, good laundry service, gorgeous location) this is it. Pool can't be called "swimming" but it is good enough to cool you down (unfortunately there is no real bar service however, room service, in time, will accomodate your request) Around here is a habit but i will never cease voicing my complaints ... In 2011 You cannot make guests pay for wifi !

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Al Barsha is excellent”
Reviews.Author: RishiR3
Reviews.Content: Ramada Chelsea is excellent value for money. It is conviniently located, close to Dubai Internet City, the Dubai Marina - lovely restaurants near the water and yachts can be rented at the marina, jumeriah and mall of the emirates. There are 4 restaurants hence you have decent choices. at 300 UAE Dirhmas - you cant get anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Flower_1979
Reviews.Content: I stopped of in Dubai for a couple of nights, stayed at the Ramada Chelsea, it was a very pleasant hotel to stay in. The room was a little small but as it was just a couple of nights i couldnt really complain. The main thing for me is that the hotel and room are clean and the staff are pleasant and helpful which is what I got from here. Getting a taxi from outside the hotel was not a problem at all as they are passing by regular. Emirates Mall is a 5-10 minute walk down the road but nobody tends to walk in Dubai as its too hot so a taxi ride it is. If we wanted to get the metro we would first get a taxi to the emirates mall and then walk over to the metro, we did this when we wanted to go to the airport as well as the metro takes you to the airport, it takes about 40 minutes from emirates mall to the airport. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel, its a very plesant hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: xcatherinex
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, staff are really friendly and they have a really good sports bar which is reasonable, they also have a stunning chineese which does all you and eat and drink for 139aed and the food is amazing!!! They have a out door bar called Mezz which is fab!! Would def recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice when on business in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Nick293934
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, comfortable and has a central location for city and FZE. The rate per room is very good value for money. The location allows for a brisk walk to MOE (if weather allows) and the Metro. Restaurants are good value for money. Not the highest luxury in a hotel but ticks all the boxes if you are having a 2 or 3 day flying visit and need a good base in Dubai. The money you save on accommodation by staying in this hotel will support an excellent lunch or dinner in the upmarket 5*s.......

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Oldstyle_53
Reviews.Content: Impossible to get a smoke-free room. They allow smoking in the hallways, so the whole place smells like an ash tray. Nasty, unfriendly staff that treat guests like idiots. Bad location - too far to walk to MOE, in the middle of an unfinished construction area. Cheap rooms are a magnet for large tour groups, so it can be very noisy. Fire alarms went off every other night - no explanation given. The roof-top swimming pool is small and harsh.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel can be better”
Reviews.Author: ennpeekay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ramada Chelsea for 3 nights recently (Feb'11). The hotel is very clean, nice rooms and peaceful. The breakfast restraunt is good for limited guests but gets messy if the hotel is full. Location is good as its close to one of the largest mall of Dubai but its little off to downtown dubai i.e Deira or Bur Dubai. Worst thing about Ramada is that they charge you for drinking water :<

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a good conference at really good rates - we all were happy !”
Reviews.Author: Jens047
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 - day - confernce with Reverends coming from various countries of the Near and Middle East. Starting from the work we had to prepare everything it was always a pleasure to meet with the Representatives to discuss the necessary things. The Hotel made a good impression throughout. The members of the conference used the short distance to MOE and felt comfortable at all times. The Best of it were the fair rates for accomodation and using the conference facilities. So I really think we got the best possible effort for our money.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR HOSPITALITY & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Anil2011
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at your hotel from the time period 28th Jan - 1st Feb 2011 in the room 514. Although the hotel was decent in terms of location and looks i would term my experience as POOR. In fact the first very day i was taken aback by the behavior of the front desk when i was handed over the keys for the room i was not even told about the Buffet Breakfast which was a part of the package i had booked. Only when i inquired myself in the night, i was told about the same. On the second day when i came back in the evening after being out of the hotel from 9:45 till about 5:45 i was surprised to see that my room was not cleaned even after the light for room cleaning instructions was left with green. When i complained i was told that the cleaning boy did not come to the hotel that day. The third also the room got cleaned improperly and the quilts were never changed in 4 nights i spent. Drinking water was given complimentary on the first night (two small bottles) and from the second day we were suppose to be charged an exorbitant amount for drinking water and therefore i avoided. I still remember my first stay in Hilton Deira which was one of my best stays in any hotel across places i have traveled. I think people can simply avoid Ramada Chelsea for the attitude of the front desk who were always rude and non-helpful and the housekeeping mess.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service lets it down big time”
Reviews.Author: vishal31
Reviews.Content: So I booked this hotel as it was 3.5 star hotel and a very reasonable price for hotels in this bracket in Dubai. The pictures painted a very modern and clean design which the hotel was. The location is ok, the maps on the internet make everything look really nearby, in reality Dubai is designed like USA everything big and distant. Its a 10 min walk to the mall, and waiting for a taxi to come back is a nightmare. Talking of taxis the prices are very reasonable. Do not use the hotel airport taxi which is 100AED, you can get one from the Airport which cost us 76 AED. Onto the service of the hotel - the service is abysmal at best. I rang up several times to get topups for the in room tea/coffee facilities. The stuff never showed up. I also asked the reception on the same night for the exact same stuff plus a blanket, again this never made it to the room. When trying to arrange for an early checkout with a taxi to take us to the airport it was like we were speaking double dutch with the reception staff. First she told us we didnt need a big car, even though we had plenty of luggage, then she said take a local cab, then flipped back to hotel cab, then back again. For god sake make up your mind, overall reception was polite but i sensed a very patrionising under tone. The second night the room was cleaned but again the in room coffee was not topped up, the complimentry water was not replaced. I rang up and told them about the poor service from the night before, luckily they got around to replacing this time however took over 15-20 mins which is not great. Breakfast was manic, it was a free for all with no control what-so-ever. One of the head waiters or breakfast manager put in a bread into the toaster after i had put 3 slices in, the first toast that popped out he grabbed which was mine, after kicking up a fuss he returned it back to me?! Excuse how rude can you possibly get. I wish i could write names of the staff on here, but im not one to name and shame. This hotel has major teething issues and at the end of day i hate to bring it up, but its because of the amount of foreign (mainly Indian) staff they employ. Im Indian myself and i know about the lack of urgency Indian workers have when told to do something. A chain like Ramada really needs to sort this out. Overall its a nice hotel, but i would flatly refuse to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of a building area and not as close to the mall as it makes out, a good 10 minute walk. The actual hotel is clean and modern but the staff lack any customer service skills whatsoever. Upon arrival there were 4 reception staff at the desk. None of them looked up or acknowledged us for minutes. Requests are not met, we asked for a telephone number and was told they were busy but would call back, they never did. The hotel boasts many restaurants which is true but with the same menu. There was only one poor waiter serving and running the whole restaurant. Tours are also very over priced here. Check rates first! Although you can get a taxi and it’s clean, Its too far out and there’s not a warm nice feel about this hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Rocketboym
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was nice but it`s area was not so good,hard to get taxi some times or walking beside some constractions sidewalkless, but the staff was so friendly and room was pleasant, although I booked upper level room but the receptionist didn`t fulfill our wish. 5-7 minutes walking from MOE and subway station was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems, but responsive management and good service helped”
Reviews.Author: Dickie1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 nights in December 2010. While there were some problems along the way, the hotel's good responsive management helped solve them. We arrived on a 6:30 a.m. flight, so we had arranged for an early arrival, for two connecting rooms with an extra bed. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at the hotel around 9:00 a.m., but no problem--normal check-in wasn't until 14:00, so we didn't mind waiting. However, when we did get our rooms, they were not connecting, and there was no extra bed. The extra bed wasn't delivered until well after the children's bedtime, and there wasn't enough room for it. Also, our room keys didn't work, and I had to return to the front desk some seven times in the first 24 hours because we couldn't get into our room. Luckily, when I brought all the room problems to the attention of the hotel's management, we were quickly moved into the connecting rooms with an extra bed that we had requested. No room problems after that. The room included breakfast, which we enjoyed every day. When we told the cooks that our kids didn't eat raisin pancakes, they happily cooked plain pancakes to order for them. Nice service in the breakfast restaurant. There's a small rooftop pool and jacuzzi, very pleasant. The fitness center is small, but adequate. The locker rooms have saunas and steam rooms (men-only and women-only). The health club staff issue towels to visitors, which is very convenient. I generally shaved and showered in the health club because the shower head in the room was mounted way too low. You can rinse yourself if you're about 165 cm or shorter; if you're tall, you wind up squatting in the tub and using the hand-held shower. There were four restaurants in the hotel, plus a "sports bar". I put the term in quotes because it had TVs showing sports, but on the nights I visited, there was loud dance/disco music blasting, the kind of music suitable for overdressed 21-year-olds. Not exactly conducive to watching sports, conversing, or relaxing. We used the breakfast restaurant every day, but didn't visit the ritzy Lebanese, Chinese, or Indian restaurants. We found a delightful local Lebanese/Chinese/Indian restaurant on the street behind the hotel called the Five Crowns, where we usually ate far too much great food, and paid on the average around 15-25 AED per person. Location was good, convenient to Wild Wadi, Ski Dubai, Mall of the Emirates, and other attractions in New Dubai and Jumeirah. Internet was not included, unfortunately, and we had to pay 112 AED/week for Internet access. It was also for one device only. We set up our notebook computer, then found out we'd have to pay AGAIN for a full subscription for iPhone access. We were happy to find bottled water in our room, "compliments of the hotel." However, it turned out to be complimentary for the first day only. Luckily, there are a couple small markets near the hotel, so we didn't wind up paying minibar prices. All in all, a pleasant enough stay. The hotel's management was attentive and responsive enough that I'll recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Trine1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Oct. Probably not the most sentral hotel in Dubai, but the price wasn't too bad compared to other places. The service was good, the room and view was nice. Approx 10mins walk to the MoE.

Reviews.Title: ““Horrible Experience, Terrible service,slow team ,noisy room !!!”
Reviews.Author: Farshad74
Reviews.Content: impolite front desk ( only one female was polite whose name was paula and she was very helpful the others were impolite and try to show that they are smart and think that the guests are child ) very unpleasant experience the location is no where and no way - far from everything - beside a counstruction area -when you want to enter to hotel you should pass a hole beside the door ! the room was noisy and the window did not close completly ,so you can hear all the street noise during the night . the room had bad smell duirng the check in and the house keeping was not good the AC was working badly the staff were not polite at all the driver from airport to hotel and vice versa were polite the staff in breakfats area were also too slow and not freindly and look very tired i aksed my company that i never go to this hotel for my next trip finally it was bad exprince for 2 nights in this hotel and the sleep quality is zeroooooo you can listen to all the noise from the other rooms as the wall is liek a paper !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff and outstanding food.”
Reviews.Author: Puddiekat
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews (some with a pinch of salt), I was interested to see what this hotel was like, From the minute I got out from the taxi to the time I left, the staff were friendly, willing to help and genuinely interested in my comments. The room was large and had a really comfortable bed. Internet was easy to connect and I don't think it was badly priced at 55AED for 24 hours. I received a call from the Duty Manager a few hours after I had arrived who asked how everything was with my room and if I had any comments. When I visited the pool, the staff member gave me a towel and escorted me out to show me where it was. On my return, a second staff member showed me round the leisure facilities at this hotel (I didn't prompt him to do this, he just offered to show me). I had dinner in the Indian restaurant where the service and food were spectacular. I have to say that I had no language problems with any of the staff - even though I was in a country miles away from my own so sometimes expect to have different nationalities there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2010OctTrip
Reviews.Content: Our company had 4 rooms booked at the Ramada Chelsea Hotel. The Hotel is brand new and our request for early check in was taken care by the Hotel, which is always a great start after a long flight. The room was well appointed with wireless internet easily accessible at a minimum cost. The hotel has a great Sports Bar where we watched with other guest the final day of the Ryder Cup. Great service through out the Hotel, though we did not try all the other outlets..I think they have 5!! Breakfast was great with a good spread of dishes. The Health Club facility is outstanding and I was there everyday in the gym and the swimming pool. Mall of the Emirates is just round the corner which helped with our last minute shopping. Overall, I had a wonderful stay and would most definetly recommend this hotel to the rest of my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: SunNSand4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights along with my wife at the Ramada Chelsea. From the time we arrived untill our departure,all we can say is WOW for what the Hotel had to offer. This is a spanking new property and the room rate is very competetive considering it is a 4 star Hotel. All the staff , from the Front Desk, to the F&B and to the boy who cleaned our room, each and every one had a smile on their face and were very courteous and professional. I/we have stayed in many properties(4 &5 star) wordlwide, and you can tell when you are in safe and good hands. As requested, we were given a non smoking room. Our room was cozy and comfortable and had all amenities that you would come to expect. Internet was charged @ Dirhams 55 for 24 hour package, which is very resonable. The Hotel has 5 restaurants, including a Sports Bar wih the highlight being our dinner at the Indian restaurant. Mind you the Chinese restaurant is another mouth watering experience. We paid for our breakfast which had a variety of dishes, the Chef even checked with my wife if her eggs were done as per her request, small touches which go a long way. The Health Club has a lovely steam & sauna room(seperate for men and women) and my wife also enjoyed a wonderful and relaxing massage. They have a open air swimming pool and a gym as well, but we gave it a miss. All in all, we had an wonderful trip to Dubai and our Hotel stay was the highlight. I would definetly recomend this Hotel to anybody and everybody, as for us we are definetly waiting for next trip to Dubai and our stay at the FANTASTIC RAMADA CHELSEA HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Impolite at reception desk and trying to play smart, very unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Hamid73
Reviews.Content: The reception desk first said they have no standard room available but they can offer more expensive Suites. When I told them I had already talked to reservation and the room is available and the price is AED240 including tax, they called reservation and talked in Indian language and suddenly said reservation has made mistake and the price of standard room has increased to AED360! I did not hesitate to go to Golden Tulip Albarsha instead, for AED350 including tax which was far better and used to me more expensive. After they denied the availability by Booking.com the standard room was available at AED200+20% tax! I arrived Dubai in the evening and directly headed to this hotel. On the way I called reservation and a lady told me the price is 199+20% tax. I had stayed there in another 2 occasions since they were the cheapest hotel around. The reception was just playing smart as they saw I am with wife and young son and it was evening so they tried to charge me more, even though I had checked with reservation few minutes before that. The guy at reception was extremely unfriendly and tried to abuse the situation.

Reviews.Title: “not adviced”
Reviews.Author: medoo1976
Reviews.Content: good location good price very bad service loooong time for check in or check out

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Diaz62
Reviews.Content: Positives - Hotel recently opened - May 2010. Non smoking room booked which was very pleasant, good size, excellent quality bed and linen etc. All mod cons in room including large flat screen tv, coffee / tea making facilities, usual freebies in Bathroom. Bathroom included bath with powerful shower and plenty of hot/cold water, free complimentary newspaper. Gym and swimming pool also included steam and sauna - all were very good. Hotel staff excellent - top class customer service as expected. Must try the International Buffet in the Seasons restaurant. All types of international food, curries, (I had the best lamb curry ever), starters, main dishes and sweets all for 59 dirhams (£10.00 approx) - a bargain! Meal Five star plus quality. 6 dirhams to use the new Metro system (£1.00 approx) transfer from the airport to the Mall of the Emirates (MOE) and I walked the rest of the way, approx 20 mins, to the Hotel. What a bargain! However, during the heat of the day a taxi from MOE to the Hotel is recommended, it costs no more than 7 dirhams, the minimum fare is 10.00 The transfer from the Hotel to the airport cost 50 dirhams. It does pay to use the Metro if you are watching your money! Negatives - Its a good 15 minute walk from the Hotel to MOE, their road system is not designed for walking and construction along the route made it interesting. Taxi drivers don't like short trips either so be prepared - don't tolerate any negative 'vibes' from them and be assertive if they are not happy. I used the MOE Metro station as my gateway to other parts of Dubai. I believe the Metro system and economic climate has taken away some of their business. I really did notice a difference on this visit. Top tips - If your on a budget, be smart, use the metro where possible its cheap clean and safe, compared to the driving antics of some taxi drivers! Overall, a hotel definitely worth a visit if travelling alone or as a couple for business or pleasure. Not one for kids, if your looking for attractions etc locate a hotel on Jumeriah Beach or Palm Island.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel and very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: mendjanbranko
Reviews.Content: Lovely crew, professional, in every time of day and night are ready to help you. Hotel is beautiful!!

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Chelsea Al Barsha
